org.jdeferred

Interface DeferredManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDeferredManager, DefaultDeferredManager

    public interface DeferredManager
    DeferredManager is especially useful when dealing with asynchronous tasks, either Runnable or Callable objects. It's also very useful when you need to get callbacks from multiple Promise objects. 
     
 DeferredManager dm = new DefaultDeferredManager();
 
 Promise p1, p2, p3;
 // p1 = ...; p2 = ...; p3 = ...;
 dm.when(p1, p2, p3)
   .done(new DoneCallback() { ... })
   .fail(new FailCallback() { ... })
   .progress(new ProgressCallback() { ... })
    When dealing with async threads: 
     
 dm.when(new Callable() { ... }, new Callable() { ... })
   .done(new DoneCallback() { ... })
   .fail(new FailCallback() { ... })
    Author:
    Ray Tsang
    See Also:
    DefaultDeferredManager, MasterDeferredObject

      • when

        Promise<MultipleResults,OneReject,MasterProgress> when(Promise... promises)
        This will return a special Promise called MasterDeferredObject. In short,
        • Promise.done(DoneCallback) will be triggered if all promises resolves (i.e., all finished successfully).
        • Promise.fail(FailCallback) will be triggered if any promises rejects (i.e., if any one failed).
        • Promise.progress(ProgressCallback) will be triggered whenever one promise resolves or rejects, or whenever a promise was notified progress.
        • Promise.always(AlwaysCallback) will be triggered whenever Promise.done(DoneCallback) or Promise.fail(FailCallback) would be triggered
        Parameters:
        promises -
        Returns:
        MasterDeferredObject
